@Ubur hm, I'm really interested now, can you whisper me your method?

The line means the same thing as an â€˜equals sign / =â€˜, that the calculation has now ended and the number that follows will be the sum/result of that calculation.  If numbers above the line are shown alone, it usually means they are positive or should be added.  If numbers are shown above the line with a dash before them ( â€“ ) or are shown in brackets/parentheses, it usually means they are negative or should be subtracted.
